member.name: T:dnSpy.Roslyn.Shared.Text.Tagging.AsyncTagger`2
member.summary: Async tagger base class. Multiple calls are handled by one task to prevent too many created tasks.
member.remarks:
All tags are cached. The cache is invalidated whenever is called with a new snapshot.
It currently doesn't try to re-use the old calculated tags. It could return those (after TranslateTo()'ing them to the new snapshot) while it executes the async code in the background that calculates the new tags.

member.name: T:dnSpy.Roslyn.Shared.Utilities.ImmutableArrayUtilities`1
member.summary: Roslyn uses but other parts of dnSpy don't. Even if all of dnSpy did, some code need to process some byte arrays before use, eg. by making every type public by modifying the metadata. Roslyn's use of will then lead to extra memory being allocated, and this memory would most likely be in the LOH (Large Object Heap). This class creates new s and overwrites the internal array field with our data to save memory.

member.name: M:dnSpy.Roslyn.Shared.Utilities.ImmutableArrayUtilities`1.ToImmutableArray(`0[])
member.summary: Creates a new by copying to the 's internal field. It doesn't waste any extra memory by allocating a duplicate array.
